data.text:
| |

Tibet Guidebooks, Tibet Books, Tibet External Links, Tibet DVDs

The following reference information is included:

Tibet Guidebooks

Tibet Books

Tibet Photo Books

Tibet External Links

Tibet Movie DVDs

Tibet Documentary DVDs

My rating scale: Excellent ; Very Good ; Good ; Fair ; Poor.

Tibet Guidebooks

Top Of Page

Tibet Books

Tibet is featured in many books. Here are my favourites:

Top Of Page

Tibet Photographic Books

Tibet is also featured in many general photographic books. Here are my favourites:

Top Of Page

Tibet External Links

Some of the official Tibet sites I visit include:

phayul.com - Tibet news updates

tibetmap.com - has especially detailed downloadable maps of many parts of Tibet

tibet.net - the official site of the Government of Tibet in Exile

dalailama.com - the official site of His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama

tibethouse.us - Tibet House introduces Tibetan culture to people through films, publications, etc., and to also raise funds to support Tibetan cultural projects like art departments in schools

savetibet.org - the International Campaign for Tibet does political advocacy on behalf of Tibet

tibetfund.org - the Tibet Fund directs economic assistance to refugees and Tibetans

Here are my favourite Tibet trekking and informational websites:

project-himalaya.com - Jamie McGuinness's company. Excellent photos from mountaineering expeditions to Shishapangma, Cho Oyu and Everest. Also includes tours/treks to Lhasa, Lhasa to Kathmandu with a stop at Everest Base Camp, Kangchenjunga, and Kailash.

American Shishapangma 2005 Expedition - over 300 photos from Lhasa to Kathmandu, and the climb of Shishapangma via the North.

en.wikipedia.org - good photos and history and current information and links on Tibet, Lhasa, Gyantse, Shigatse, etc.. It is also featured in wikitravel.

Google Earth - zoom in on Tibet, look around, and simulate walking around to get a sort-of visual perspective on what you can see. Great fun.

Nasa - has some spectacular photos of Tibet, especially the mountains.

I thoroughly enjoy reading other people's Tibet travelogues and looking through their Tibet photos. Here are my favourites:

painetworks.com - many sensational photos of Tibet for viewing or for sale. Includes Lhasa and even inside the Jokhang, Shigatse, Gyantse, and Samye.

denverhughes.net - Denver Hughes and his family travel from Kathmandu to Lhasa in 2001, with Tibet photos and a travelogue.

jonathanbaker.org - Jonathan Baker has many excellent photos of his 2004 bicycle journey from Lhasa to Kathmandu, with a detour to Everest North Base Camp.

flickr.com (steynard) - Steynard has very good photos from 2006 of Lhasa, Gyantse, Shigatse before trekking to Everest East Kangshung Base Camp, then driving to Everest North Base Camp, trekking to Everest North Advanced Base Camp, and climbing Lhaka Ri.

flickr.com (romana chapman) - Romana Chapman has visited Tibet several time over the past few years and has great photos of Lhasa, the train trip to Chengdu, Everest, Mount Kailash, Guge Kingdom, etc.

betzgi.ch - Beat Heim has very good photos of his four-month bicycle trip in 1997 from Pakistan along the Karakorum Highway to China, and across the Tibetan plateau from Golmud to Lhasa and on to Kathmandu. From January 2005 to January 2006 he bicycled from Switzerland to Hong Kong, including Guge Kingdom and Mount Kailash to Lhasa.

pbase.com (Matthew Herschmann) - Matthew Herschmann has many excellent photos of Lhasa, the trip along the Friendship Highway to Kathmandu, Namtso, Eastern Tibet, Changtang, Amdo and Kham

flickr.com, pbase.com, picasaweb.google.com, and trekearth.com - lots of photos.

Top Of Page
